item.title: Quick question about outStream
item.dc:creator: @D_E_C_O_Y D E C O Y
item.description:
@D_E_C_O_Y wrote:

[quote=“Haxmeh, post:4, topic:111684”]100%
Basically what an out stream is a creating of a new partial of depending what you label it as.

So:

/DELETE OBJECT/
outStream.writeByte(101);
outStream.writeByteA(0);
outStream.writeByte(0);
/CREATE OBJECT/[/quote]

I swear, some people are pretty retarded, we didn’t code the STREAM class, why do you think it has the GNU license, its just a basic Packet handler, so i’m pretty sure you just changed some stuff around. but i’m pretty sure you and him have the same stream class, quit using private server script. you scape-lander

Read full topic

item.title: Quick question about outStream
item.dc:creator: @Haxmeh Haxmeh
item.description:
@Haxmeh wrote:

On mine it says:

public void writeByteA(int i) {
buffer[currentOffset++] = (byte)(i + 128);
}

public void writeByteS(int i) {
buffer[currentOffset++] = (byte)(128 + i);
}
Sorry I guess we mis-understood each other.
May I have the help on my topic?
At least I tried.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick question about outStream
item.dc:creator: @frugoo_scape frugoo scape
item.description:
@frugoo_scape wrote:

NOOB!

public void writeByteA(int i) {
	buffer[currentOffset++] = (byte)(i + 128);
}

public void writeByteS(int i) {
	buffer[currentOffset++] = (byte)(128 - i);
}

Read full topic

item.title: Quick question about outStream
item.dc:creator: @Haxmeh Haxmeh
item.description:
@Haxmeh wrote:

100%
Basically what an out stream is a creating of a new partial of depending what you label it as.

So:

/DELETE OBJECT/
outStream.writeByte(101);
outStream.writeByteA(0);
outStream.writeByte(0);
/CREATE OBJECT/
if (NewObjectID > -1) {

would have no different effect as:

/DELETE OBJECT/
outStream.writeByte(101);
outStream.writeByteS(0);
outStream.writeByte(0);
/CREATE OBJECT/
if (NewObjectID > -1) {

Read full topic
